敗.definition: to defeat; to damage; to lose (to an opponent); to fail; to wither

敗光.definition: to squander one's fortune; to dissipate one's wealth

敗北.definition: (literary) to be routed (in a war); to suffer defeat (in sports etc)

敗壞.definition: to ruin; to corrupt; to undermine

敗子.definition: see 敗家子|败家子[bai4 jia1 zi3]

敗戰.definition: to lose a war; fig. the loser (in a competition or election)

敗柳殘花.definition: broken flower, withered willow (idiom); fig. fallen woman

敗毒.definition: (TCM) to relieve inflamation and internal heat; to detoxify

敗筆.definition: a faulty stroke in calligraphy or painting; a faulty expression in writing

敗績.definition: to be utterly defeated; to be routed

敗胃.definition: (of food or medicine) to impair digestion; to suppress appetite; (fig.) (of some objectionable aspect of sth) to cause one to lose interest; to put one off

敗落.definition: (of status or wealth) to decline; (of buildings etc) to become dilapidated; run-down; (of plants) to wilt

敗陣.definition: to be defeated on the battlefield; to be beaten in a contest

敗露.definition: (of a plot etc) to fall through and stand exposed
